education.description: I am currently studying for a Bachelor's degree in Computer Software Engineering at the University of Agder. The program is a three-year program that focuses on software development, programming, and computer science. The program also includes subjects such as databases, web development, and software architecture.

work.description: As a student assistant, my job involved helping students during lab hours, grading assignments, and creating course material. The course, Data Modeling and Databases (IKT105), aims to teach students about relational databases, SQL, and entity-relationship modeling.
work.title: Student Assistant

work.description: As a FYSE coach I work as a student mentor through UiA's First Year Study Environment. This arrangement means that all first-year students get an experienced student to guide them through their first semester. Here I hold weekly meetings where I help the students with subjects such as coding and mathematics. The training to become a FYSE mentor at UiA also involves a separate subject that goes through topics such as interpersonal skills, group management and study strategies.
work.title: Student Mentor

work.description: Worked as a summer temp in Telenor Kristiansand. Here I helped customers with everything from simple product questions to more complicated technical challenges related to Telenor's mobile and internet products. The role also involved sales of Telenor's products.
work.title: Customer Service Representative

projects.name: Trainer Website
projects.description: Served as Scrum master and developer on a website project with 3 other students as part of UiA's Internet Services course. The website allowed users to create, share, log, and view statistics for workouts. They could also use our integration of OpenAI's chatGPT API to generate workouts.

projects.name: Trainer App
projects.description: As part of UiA's Mobile Development course, I worked in a group of students to develop a mobile app version of the trainer website. The app also served as a refined version of the website, with a focus on mobile usability, performance and security.

projects.name: PlayPileup
projects.description: A proof of concept for a web-based game library collector, where users could add games from their different game libraries (Steam, Epic Games, etc.) and view them in one place. The backend of the project uses Django's DRF to provide REST API endpoints for the React-based frontend. Authentication is done using JWT.

projects.name: Portfolio Website
projects.description: A personal portfolio website to showcase my projects, skills, and experience. The website is mainly built with React, but utilizes Firebase to streamline information retrieval and storage. GitHub pages are used for hosting.

projects.name: PopKernel OS
projects.description: 32bit OS created as a project in the course Advanced Operating Systems at UiA. The OS is written in C/C++ and Assembly, and runs on a VM. The OS has memory management, ISRs and IRQs, PIT, keyboard input, and a simple shell. It includes different demo programs and tests to showcase the OS's capabilities. This includes a drawing program and a muisc player.

projects.name: Smart Watch
projects.description: Smart watch project utilizing the STMICROELECTRONICS B-L475E-IOT01A1 development kit. Created as part of UiA's second semester exam project in the microcontroller course for computer engineering students. The watch can display time, date, temperature, and humidity, and includes functionality for changing the time zone. It also has the ability to set alarms, showcase the weather, and display an RSS feed.
